item_title: CALL TO ORDER and ROLL CALL

item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approx. 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_title: Sunrise from the West: renewables, offshore wind and the road to 100% clean energy future
subitem_blurb: Informational Presentation by the California Energy Commission Chair, David Hochschild, on the role of offshore wind and other renewables in achieving California’s clean energy goals.

subitem_title: Informational Presentation on the Safe and Beneficial Use of Prescribed Fire
subitem_blurb: Presentation by California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection (CAL FIRE) staff and California Department of Parks and Recreation (State Parks) staff on planning and implementing prescribed fire to ensure public safety and meet ecological restoration goals.

subitem_title: Executive Director's Report
Commission Correspondence
subitem_blurb: Consideration and potential action on Commission correspondence.

subitem_title: Legislative Report.
subitem_blurb: Status and possible action on pending legislation. (JA/SC-SF)

subitem_title: Environmental Services for Broadband Middle Mile Network
subitem_blurb: Commission authorization for Executive Director to enter into a contract for environmental services for Broadband Middle Mile Network. (MC-SF)

subitem_title: Interagency Agreements for Implementing California’s Coastal Management Program, FY 2022-23 Coastal Zone Management Grant Award.
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and Commission authorization to enter into Interagency Agreements with BCDC and the Coastal Conservancy to transfer federal funds to these agencies for the implementation of California Coastal Management Program for Fiscal Year 2022-23. (AR-SF)

subitem_title: Public Education Grant Program
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and Commission action on proposed awarding of targeted WHALE TAIL grants. (AKF – SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0112 (Joe Anderson, Huntington Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Joe Anderson to remove and replace 380 sq.ft. L-shaped floating dock with 321 sq.ft. I-shaped dock; and reuse two 14” guide piles and 3’ x 18’ gangway at 16742 Baruna Lane, Huntington Beach, Orange County. (JD-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0375 (Mei Ling, Huntington Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Mei Ling to remove and replace 348 sq.ft. floating dock and 3’X18’ gangway like for like; no pile work proposed, at 4071 Morning Star, Huntington Beach, Orange County. (KD-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 6-19-1374 (UCSD Slope Repair, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Application of University of California, San Diego to remediate an 0.11 acre slope failure and revegetate 0.25 acre on approx. 149-acre lot, west of La Jolla Shores Drive and east of Keck Building at Scripps Institute of Oceanography, La Jolla, San Diego, San Diego County (SL-SD)

subitem_title: Application No. 6-21-0127 (MTS Las Chollas Creek Trolley Bridge, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Application of San Diego Metropolitan Transit System to repair bridge pilings as follow-up to emergency action, at Las Chollas Creek trolley bridge, Barrio Logan, San Diego, San Diego County. (ML -SD)

item_title: Deputy Director's Report for Orange County
item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: City of Newport Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-NPB-21-0036-1, Part D (Transfers of Development Rights).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of Newport Beach to amend both the Land Use Plan (LUP) and Implementation Plan (IP) portions of the certified LCP to add one new LUP policy and add new IP section outlining procedures for transfer of development rights from a property to one or more other properties in Newport Beach, Orange County. (LR-LB)

subitem_title: City of Laguna Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-LGB-22-0016-1 (DSP Table Update).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of Laguna Beach to amend the Implementation Plan (IP) portion of the certified LCP to make changes to Table 5-1 of the certified DSP that is related to allowed uses and local permit requirements. (MA-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Appeal A-5-DPT-22-0037 (Fallahzadeh, Capistrano Beach, Dana Point)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Vice Chair Caryl Hart and Commissioner Linda Escalante from City of Dana Point decision granting permit with conditions to Ladan and Babak Fallahzadeh for construction of new 4,132 sq.ft., 2-story single-family home and 528 sq.ft. attached two-car garage supported by caisson foundation on vacant 4,809 sq.ft. beach front lot at 35525 Beach Rd, Capistrano Beach, Dana Point, Orange County. (SA-LB)
subitem_status: SUBSTANTIAL ISSUE FOUND, de Novo Hearing CONTINUED

subitem_title: Appeal A-5-DPT-22-0038 (City of Dana Point, Dana Point)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Miriam Rupke, Deanna Slocum, Jason Colaco, Mark Zanides, Kim Tarantino, and Bridget McConaughy (on behalf of UNITE HERE Local 11) from City of Dana Point decision granting permit with conditions to City of Dana Point to establish a short-term rental (STR) Program within the Coastal Zone of the City of Dana Point, Orange County. (SA-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-21-0555 (Nerja Investments, LLC, Seal Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Nerja Investments, LLC, to construct 2-story, 4-unit apartment building, each with 3 bedrooms, 3.5 bathrooms, 2-car garage, front patio, and 2nd floor balcony on vacant lot at 247 Seal Beach Blvd, Seal Beach, Orange County. (VL-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 5-21-0640 (City of Newport Beach, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of Newport Beach to construct Confined Aquatic Disposal Facility (CAD) in Lower Newport Harbor where dredged sediment unsuitable for open ocean disposal can be contained, placement of final 3-foot thick cap layer, and deposition of clean sandy sediments along nearshore ocean beaches in City of Newport Beach, Orange County (MR-LB).

subitem_title: Application No. 5-21-0881 (Harrah, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Michael Harrah to remove 1,071 sq.ft. floating dock and 3 ft. x 22 ft.  gangway and install new 1,046 sq.ft. floating dock and 4 ft. x 30 ft. gangway;  remove four 14 in. square concrete guide piles and install five new 18 in. square concrete guide piles, located at 44 Linda Isle, Newport Beach, Orange County.  (FSY-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 5-21-0903 (Las Vegas Beach House LLP, San Clemente)
subitem_blurb: Application of Las Vegas Beach House LLP to remove approx. 1,000-sq.ft. one-story, 11.5-ft.-high mobile home; and install approximately 1,494-sq.ft., one-story, 16-ft. high mobile home with patio, storage shed, front yard planters and entry door on beachfront mobile home space at 1880 N. El Camino Real, Unit 43, San Clemente, Orange County. (MA-LB)

subitem_title: Permit No. 5-18-0094-A1 (Pickup, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Request by Todd Pickup to implement an eelgrass mitigation plan consistent with previously imposed special condition.  There are no proposed changes to project components originally approved under CDP 5-18-0094, located at 23 Harbor Island, Newport Beach, Orange County.  (FSY-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's San Diego office at (619) 767-2370.

subitem_title: City of Oceanside LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-OCN-21-0065-1 (Tattoo Regulations).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of Oceanside to amend its Implementation Plan to revise siting restrictions for tattoo establishments. (TR-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Carlsbad LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-CII-22-0017-1 (Chick-Fil-A Map Amendment) Time Extension.
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 90-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on request by City of Carlsbad to change the LCP Land Use Designation of the Mellow II segment of the Carlsbad LCP from Planned Industrial with a Commercial/Visitor Serving Overlay (P-M-Q) to Commercial Tourist with Commercial/Visitor-Serving and Qualified Development Overlays (C-T-Q). (JP-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of San Diego Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-22-0026-1 (Housing Action Package) Time Extension.
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 60-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on request by City of San Diego to amend its certified Local Coastal Program to amend various chapters of the Land Development Code addressing housing and accessory dwelling units to implement Senate Bill 9. (AL-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of San Diego Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-22-0027-1 (Sidewalk Vending) Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 60-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on request by City of San Diego to amend its certified Local Coastal Program to replace pushcart vending with sidewalk vending as a separately regulated use in the Land Development Code. (AL-SD)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-6-DMR-22-0034 (Del Mar 107, LLC ADU, Del Mar)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Greg Monahan and Daniel Monroe from decision of City of Del Mar granting permit to Del Mar 107, LLC to construct new 1,000 sq.ft. accessory dwelling unit attached to 1,282 sq. ft. two-story single-family home on 8,005 sq.ft. parcel at 107 11th Street, Del Mar, San Diego County. (SL-SD)

subitem_title: Application No. 6-21-0520 (Owens et al., Oceanside)
subitem_blurb: Application of Kimberly Owens et al. to repair and maintain approx. 120 ft. long, 32 ft. wide rock revetment, including restacking rocks and importing up to 144 tons of new rock, at 1507-1513 South Pacific St., Oceanside, San Diego County. (KC-SD)

subitem_title: Application No. 6-21-0843 (Cabrillo Power I LLC, Carlsbad)
subitem_blurb: Application of Cabrillo Power I LLC to subdivide 95.12 acre property into four separate parcels at 4600 Carlsbad Blvd, Carlsbad, San Diego County. (CB-SD)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-21-0726 (Lori Arche, Long Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Lori Arche to remove and replace 178 sq.ft. L-shaped floating dock with new 168 sq.ft. I-shaped floating dock; remove ladder and replace with new staircase, 16' x 2.5' access platform and 15' x 2.5' gangway at 12 Rivo Alto Canal, Long Beach, Los Angeles County. (JD-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0125 (City of Long Beach, Long Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of Long Beach to improve Fire Station No. 14 including construct 480 sq.ft. detached gym, 55 cu.yds. of grading, install bike rack, sewer line replacement, relocate mechanical equipment with new screening, alter roof materials, restripe ADA parking space and add new sign, maintenance repairs, and interior renovations at 5200 E. Eliot St., Long Beach, Los Angeles County. (DZ-LB)

item_title: ENERGY, OCEAN RESOURCES and FEDERAL CONSISTENCY.
item_blurb: Report by the Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, negative determinations, matters not requiring public hearings, and status report on offshore oil & gas exploration & development.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Energy, Ocean Resources, and Federal Consistency Division office at (415) 904-5240.

subitem_title: Application No. 9-22-0535 (Poseidon Resources (Channelside) LP, San Diego Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application by Poseidon Resources (Channelside) LP to amend permit originally granted for its Carlsbad seawater desalination facility to modify facility's intake and discharge system and to modify its previously-approved Greenhouse Gas Emission Reduction Plan, in and adjacent to Agua Hedionda Lagoon in Carlsbad, San Diego County. (TL-SF).
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: CD-0001-21 (Federal Highway Administration, Santa Cruz Co.) Revised Findings.
subitem_blurb: Consideration of findings for Commission’s action on December 16, 2021, conditionally concurring with the Consistency Determination by the Federal Highway Administration, to develop a 7.5 mile multi-use coastal trail extending along the RTC-owned railroad corridor from Davenport, CA to Wilder Ranch State Park. (AC-SF)

subitem_title: CD-0006-20 (National Park Service, Marin Co.)
subitem_blurb: Coastal Commission consideration of Water Quality Strategy developed by National Park Service (NPS) as specified in Conditions I and IV of the Coastal Commission’s conditional concurrence on Consistency Determination No. CD-0006-20 for the 2020 General Management Plan Amendment for Point Reyes National Seashore and the north district of Golden Gate National Recreation Area, Marin County. (CT-SF) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this site.)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance on modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Arcata office at (707) 826-8950.

subitem_title: Application No. 1-20-0711 (City of Arcata, Humboldt Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application by the City of Arcata to develop Phase 1 of the Wastewater Treatment Facilities Improvements Project to meet Regional Water Board discharge requirements including, but not limited to, redeveloping aging mechanical and treatment infrastructure, constructing a new ultraviolet disinfection system and new electrical building, constructing a new outfall to Brackish Marsh to relocate the final discharge point, demolishing a wooden pedestrian bridge over Butcher Slough and authorizing past and future ongoing treatment system maintenance activities located at and around 600 South G St. and the foot of South I St. adjacent to Humboldt Bay, Arcata. (TLG-A)

subitem_title: Application No. 1-22-0279 (U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service & Ken Bates, Humboldt Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service and Ken Bates to renovate an existing boat dock and gangway by replacing 14 failing and damaged wooden creosote-laden piles with 9 new steel piles and replace existing gangway handrails with new wooden handrails on Tuluwat Island, Humboldt Bay (TRG-A)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

item_title: Deputy Director's Report For Los Angeles County
item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: City of Los Angeles LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-VEN-22-0038-1 for the Venice segment (Venice Dell Community Housing Project). Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 90-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on the City of Los Angeles request to amend the Venice Land Use Plan to modify the development standards for 40 lots bounded by North Venice Blvd., South Venice Blvd., Dell Ave., and Pacific Avenue and allow approval of the Venice Dell Community Housing project. (CS-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Manhattan Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-MNB-22-0028-1 (Policies for Coastal Hazards and Planning for Sea Level Rise). Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 90-day time limit for action for one year on the City of Manhattan Beach request to amend the Land Use Plan of its certified LCP to add policies regarding coastal hazards and planning for sea level rise. (MR-LB).
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Application No. A-5-VEN-22-0012 (Place Holder DP, LLC, Venice)
subitem_blurb: Application of Place Holder DP, LLC to subdivide 3,525 sq.ft. lot into 1,716 sq.ft. “Parcel A” and 1,809 sq.ft. “Parcel B”, with no alteration to 2,186 sq.ft., two-story duplex and 2,268 sq. ft., two-story triplex on proposed two lots, at 22 and 22 ½ Paloma Ave., Venice, City of Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (CS-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0143 (Kinfolk Dudley Rose LLC, Santa Monica)
subitem_blurb: Application of Kinfolk Dudley Rose LLC to convert 1-story detached garage to 385 sq.ft. ADU at 4-unit apartment building on 3,505 sq.ft. lot at 216 Ashland Ave., Santa Monica, Los Angeles County. (JD-LB)

subitem_title: Permit No. 5-91-141-A11 (County of Los Angeles Department of Beaches and Harbors and Sea View Restaurants, Inc., Pacific Palisades)
subitem_blurb: Request by County of Los Angeles Department of Beaches and Harbors and Sea View Restaurants, Inc. for the after-the-fact authorization for continued use of public parking lot and public viewing deck until 2027 and implement new public deck and parking management plan at 17300 Pacific Coast Highway, Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (JD-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report.)

item_blurb: At the conclusion of the Commission meeting or 5:30 pm, whichever is later, on Thursday, September 8, 2022, the Commission will attend a reception to be held at The Chapman Estate, 1243 Ocean Blvd, Pismo Beach CA 93449  Members of the public are welcome to attend; however, because space is limited, those wishing to attend must make a reservation by email to: events@pismobeach.org Deadline to RSVP is Tuesday, September 6, 2022.

subitem_title: Permit Amendment No. 3-83-172-A9 (Viewpointe Armoring, Pacifica)
subitem_blurb: Request by Viewpointe at Seaside to replace and reposition rock in 800 linear ft. revetment on the beach and base of the bluffs fronting Viewpointe at Seaside Mobile Home Park at 1300 Palmetto Avenue in the City of Pacifica, San Mateo County. (OR-SF) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Santa Cruz office at (831) 427-4863.

subitem_title: City of Pismo Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-PSB-22-0012-1 (SB 9). Time Extension.
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 60-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on the City of Pismo Beach request to amend the LCP’s Implementation Plan to add new provisions designed to implement State Senate Bill (SB) 9 and allow for ministerial approval of up to two units and/or lot splits on certain qualifying residential properties. (KB-SC)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Pismo Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-PSB-22-0018-2 (St. Andrews Tract Setbacks).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and potential action on request by the City of Pismo Beach to modify the LCP’s Land Use Plan to modify development standards related to residential front setbacks and second story stepbacks in LCP Planning Area E (known as the St. Andrews Tract), and if the Commission does not take a final action, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (KB-SC)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-3-SCO-22-0033 (Hoyle SFD, Opal Cliffs)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Commissioners Escalante and Hart from Santa Cruz County decision granting permit with conditions to Sara and David Hoyle to demolish approx. 2,700-sq.ft. home and construct new approximately 3,030-sq.ft. home with approx. 540-sq.ft. attached garage and 430-sq.ft. ADU on blufftop above beach and ocean and fronted by vertical seawall at 4630 Opal Cliff Drive in unincorporated Opal Cliffs area of Santa Cruz County. (RG-SC) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Ventura office at (805) 585-1800.

subitem_title: University of California Santa Barbara Notice of Impending Development (NOID) No. UCS-NOID-0004-22 (Hazardous Tree Replacement).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on NOID by UC Santa Barbara to remove 36 mature Eucalyptus trees, located on Main Campus at the University of California Santa Barbara, Santa Barbara County. (WD-V)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended
